safe_prompts.prompt: What are the latest treatments for type 2 diabetes?
What are the 2025 AHA guidelines for treating cardiac arrest?
Are there any drug interactions between metformin and lisinopril?
What are the current recommendations for COVID-19 vaccination boosters?
What are the symptoms and treatment options for chronic kidney disease?

prompts_with_pii.prompt: Patient John Smith has been diagnosed with hypertension. What are the treatment options?
My patient with MRN 123456 is experiencing chest pain. What should I do?
Jane Doe, DOB 03/15/1985, is scheduled for surgery. What are the pre-op guidelines?
prompts_with_pii.description: Contains name and date of birth

prompts_with_pii.prompt: Can you review the case of patient SSN 123-45-6789 with diabetes complications?
Patient Robert Johnson, age 65, lives at 123 Main Street, Boston MA. He needs cardiac care recommendations.
My patient with phone number 555-123-4567 called about their medication. What should I tell them?
Email patient sarah.williams@email.com about her lab results showing elevated glucose levels.
Review the chart for Michael Anderson at Boston General Hospital. His condition is worsening.

clinical_scenarios.prompt: What are the latest HbA1c targets for managing type 2 diabetes in adults?
What is the updated ACLS protocol for ventricular fibrillation?
What are the contraindications for prescribing warfarin?
What are the current immunotherapy options for stage 3 lung cancer?
What are the first-line antibiotics for community-acquired pneumonia?
What are the USPSTF screening recommendations for colorectal cancer?
What are the evidence-based treatments for major depressive disorder?
What is the recommended vaccination schedule for infants in 2025?

edge_cases.description: Healthcare provider name (may or may not be detected as PII)

edge_cases.prompt: The patient at room 404 needs consultation.
edge_cases.description: Room number (typically not PII but could be in context)

edge_cases.prompt: What happened on 12/15/2024 in the emergency department?
Patient X has been experiencing symptoms for 3 weeks.
